intro: Legousia durandei, commonly known as the Durand's legousia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds in capsule fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
